Hi,

There are a couple of optional Ant task that use 3rdparty tools to give you
this information and more.

One is jdepend which invokes the free JDepend parser
(http://www.clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html).  I've used this task with
success, especially now that there is a style sheet to transform the output
into a nice html report (you'll need the nightly release of Ant to get
this).

Another is task, mmetrics (Metamata Metrics), uses Webgain QA/Metamata
Metrics to give you all sorts of information like this.  See
http://icarus.apache.org/~sbailliez/jakarta-ant/metrics/ as an example.  I
haven't personally used this one as jdepend has been all I've needed.  It
does seems quite comprehensive though I don't know how much it costs.

HTH,
Chuck

-----Original Message-----
From: Richard Brooks [mailto:rbrooks@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 07, 2002 9:59 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Class coupling measure?



I apologize for being a bit off topic but I was wondering, given the
wealth of testing knowledge in this group, if anyone has run across a
good tool for automated evaluation of coupling in a system of java
programs?

The ObjectMentor guys have this bash shell
script(http://www.objectmentor.com/resources/downloads/index) which does
it for directories of C++ code but I wonder if there's something a bit
more accessible and java oriented?

Thanks for any pointers,
Richard

subject: RE: [junit] Class coupling measure?
